member.summary: To mark on a type, to tell the user and the compiler that the source generator should automatically generate the ToString methods and .

member.name: T:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.AutoGeneratePrimaryConstructorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the marked should generate primary constructor automatically.

member.name: T:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.AutoGetEnumeratorAttribute
member.summary: To mark on a type, to tell the compiler that the compiler will automatically generate GetEnumerator methods for that type.

member.name: M:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.AutoGetEnumeratorAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes an instance with the specified member name.
member.param: The member name. If you want to pass "this" as the reference, just input "@".

member.name: P:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.AutoGetEnumeratorAttribute.MemberName
member.summary: Indicates the member name.

member.name: P:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.AutoGetEnumeratorAttribute.MemberConversion
member.summary: Indicates the member conversion that is used for creation of the enumerator.

remarks.para:
This property should be stored a lambda body. One of possible syntaxes is:
[AutoGetEnumerator(nameof(MemberName), "((IEnumerable<int>)@).*")]
Where:
'@' Equivalent to the member.
'*' Equivalent to the code GetEnumerator().

member.name: P:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.AutoGetEnumeratorAttribute.ExtraNamespaces
member.summary: Indicates the extra namespace should be imported.

member.name: P:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.AutoGetEnumeratorAttribute.ReturnType
member.summary: Indicates the return type. If , the value of type of will be returned.

member.name: P:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.AutoHashCodeAttribute.DataMembers
member.summary: All members to generate.

member.name: T:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.CodeAnalyzerAttribute
member.summary: To mark on a code analyzer type, to tell the compiler and the source generator that the type should generate the default values.
member.remarks:
The supported diagnostic IDs should satisfy the follow condition:
The ID should be combined with 2 upper-case letters and 4 numbers.
The upper-case letters should be SS or SD.
If the diagnostic result should fade out the code, just apply the suffix "F", such as SS0101F, where the suffix "F" is the abbreviation of the phrase "fade out".

member.name: M:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.CodeAnalyzerAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a class instance using the specified diagnostic ID list.

member.name: P:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.CodeAnalyzerAttribute.SupportedDiagnosticIdList
member.summary: Indicates the supported diagnostic IDs.

member.name: T:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.ProxyEqualityAttribute
member.summary: Indicates an attribute instance which is marked on a method, to tell the users and the compiler that this method is an equality method to judge whether two instances contain the same value.
member.remarks: Because of the limitation of the algorithm and the source generator, the method marked this attribute must be . If you marks on a method that isn't a method, the source generator will do nothing.

member.name: M:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.Extensions.INamedTypeSymbolEx.ToFileName(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol)
member.summary: Get the file name of the type symbol.
member.returns:
The file name. Due to the limited file name and the algorithm, if:
The character is '<' or '>': Change them to '[' and ']'.
The character is ',': Change it to '_'.
The character is ' ': Remove it.

member.name: T:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.EqualsMethodGenerator
member.summary:
Indicates the generator that generates the methods about the equality checking. The methods below will be generated:
bool Equals(object? obj)
bool Equals(T comparer)
bool ==(T left, T right)
bool !=(T left, T right)
member.remarks: Please note that if the type is a , the first one won't be generated because this method is useless in the by-ref-like types.

member.name: T:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.EqualsMethodGenerator.SyntaxReceiver
member.summary: Defines the syntax receiver.

member.name: P:Sudoku.CodeGenerating.EqualsMethodGenerator.SyntaxReceiver.Candidates
